scenario:
Booking Holdings would have turned a $1,000 investment into approximately $180,000 over 20 years. The company reported $23.7 billion in sales and $5.9 billion in profits last year. It owns Booking.com, Kayak.com, and Priceline.com and has a market value of around $150 billion. Despite near-term economic challenges, it is considered a good buy for long-term growth in the travel industry.

Apple, the most valuable company in the world with a market cap of $3.3 trillion, would have turned a $1,000 investment into approximately $151,000 over 20 years. Its revenue growth has been modest, but its services business generated 14% revenue growth last quarter and now accounts for over one-fifth of the company's total revenue. Apple has generated more than $98 billion in free cash flow over the trailing 12 months and is considered a dependable investment.

Regeneron Pharmaceuticals would have turned a $1,000 investment into approximately $125,000 over 20 years. The company has generated more than $14.2 billion in sales and $4.4 billion in net income. It has a strong pipeline of potential drug candidates and is considered a good buy and hold stock, trading at 14 times its estimated future earnings.
